text: ma premiere TDD, javais très hate dy gouter. Jespérais quelque chose du genre Aventinus, proche mais pas aussi bon.

Je mattendais à un peu plus au nez de cette bouteille de 660mL de Shawinigan Handshake, présentée comme étant plutôt houblonnée, mais je me retrouve devant une bière blanche très dans le style allemand, avec les traditionnelles saveurs de bananes et de clou de girofle. Cest bien fait, fort facile à boire, mais elle gagnerait peut-être à avoir un petit dryhop de houblons noble.
Intense foam and hazy darkened straw. Deep fried bananas and a faint citrus nose, heavily carbonated. Almost chewy, a lighter yeast flavor with a clean banana and faintly tropical finish.

Visual: (Their own bottle for their brewery, raised lettering and devil on the bottom, odd size 600ml). Pours almost clear pale light orange with smallish dissipating head, ringed retention, clusters of fast active streams.

Nose: light peachy banana wheat malt. (lvl-3)-pungency

Attack: smooth thick CO2, micro-tingly crisp

Mid-palate: bright fruity banana, (lvl-4-sweetness), pineapple grainy wheat malt, tangy light alcohol

Finish: bready barley malt, banana wheat malt exhale

Summary: Solid quality mouthfeel and a robust wheat-barley malt body. It made me feel bloated one glass in though.

Bottle. Hazy gold, head is 6 inches on the first pour. Aroma of toasted bread, vanilla, banana. Sweet biscuit and bread, some banana, spices creep up along with bitterness. Peach bubblegum. Palate has a convincingly German thorough maltiness that just falls away a little soon. Pretty good. No convinced its all that fresh, but there may be swings as well as roundabout there.
On tap at St. Augustines during 1st 45 taps annual event with Alex and Josh. Pours a cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma is wheat, fruity, slightly sour. Taste is smooth, fruity. Quite pleasant.

Aromas of banana, clove and wheat. Appearance is a golden yellow, with spotty lacing. Taste is banana, clove, bread, apples, white pepper. Palate is medium bodied with a dry and very mildly bitter finish. Overall- Enjoyable, I was expecting more hops but it might be a bit old.

Bottle into glass. Pleasant wheat and banana aroma. Pours cloudy pale golden with white head. Has a light sweet taste followed by a sour finish. Medium bodied with a creamy texture. A very nice example of a Weizen Bock.

Hazy pale straw color with tons of powerful activity. Extra foamy and frothy 4 finger sparkly explosive island head in the weizen glass, lasting around 10 minutes, with some average leggings.

Aromas of fresh flowers and zesty lemon. Flavors of lemon, sweet grains, yeasty bread, noble hops, fruit esters, floral and herbal spices. Balanced and delicate subtle flavors of sugary fruits with a nice sharpness.
Grainy and wheaty roasted bread feel.

Smooth light to medium body with a moderate amount of carbonation. Well intensified medium strength finish, ending with a spicy and yeasty tongue coat, some fruity citrus and floral feel.

Overall excellent quality craft offering an incredible smell and great flavors that feels much like a belgian tripel. Very sexy and well balanced, nice intensity, and quite complex. Although well refreshing, its a little vinous, highly acidic, with a faint metallic feel.
Cloudy pale fluffy head. Smell cloves citrus peel. Light bitterness spice throughout good carbonation.
cereal, floral, citrus, banana, bubblegum, vanilla, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, creamy, fizzy, long, bitter finish,

Bottle from NB Liquor. Cloudy pale orange amber with a fluffy off white head that recedes gradu ally and leaves some sparse lace. Nose is banana, cloves, resin, light peach and citrus peel. Flavour follows with a lightly sweet honey supporting a lightly bitter grass in essence with a touch of lemon tartness and a balanced spice throughout. Mouth is medium and chewy with prickly carbonation. A great combination of elements that works well.

9-/4/8-/4/16

A pillowy white head on a golden straw body with very visible carbonation. The nose is a rich banana bread with malt and a touch of spiciness. The taste profile continues with the banana bread theme, chewy malt, some spice and pepper, orange and a hint of celery salt. Quite a dense body for a Weizen Bock but very refreshing at the same time.
Cleaning the garage and drinking this stupidly amazing beer. Creamy malt with peach and over-risen bread yeast. An ever so mild bite at the end of hop and carbonation. Really, a spectacular beer.
Peach-Yellow, slightly sour with a slightly bitter finish with lots of carbonation. One of the best from Trou du Diable.
Pours orange yellow, lovely head. Aroma of orange, spices. Taste is similar with a hint of banana near the end, slight watery finish. Excellent.

Où, Quand, Comment : 
Dégustée en fût sur place, le 7/20/2013. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : orangée. 
Apparence : voilée. 


Arôme :  

Levures fruitées (bananes, notes dagrumes) et épicées (clou de girofle), pain, blé, léger houblon herbeux aux notes résineuse.


Goût :  
Entrée de bouche : Levures fruitées (moyen de bananes, notes dagrumes) et épicées (clou de girofle, notes poivrées). 
Un support de blé et de pain est également bien présent avec une légère amertume de houblon herbeux et résineux ainsi quavec des traces de caramel. 


En bouche :  

Corps : moyen.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : légèrement huileuse.
Finale : moyenne et aux notes sèches, composée dune légère amertume de houblon herbeux et résineux avec des petites notes acidulées de blé.

Hazy peach color with a medium white head. Aroma is bready with a hint of spices, yeast, and floral and fruity hops. Flavor is similar to the aroma with a sweet malt base and a very mild bitter finish and a hint of banana. Medium body.

600ml bottle. Golden-orange in colour with a large and long lasting white head, very good lacing. The aroma is hoppy, floral, wheaty, bananas. The flavour is wheaty and bitter, some oranges, bananas, floral hops, some spice. Bitter mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation. Finishes long, bitter, wheaty. This isnt like any other Weizen Bock Ive had. Lots of fruit and hops. IPA ish.

Large head deep gold pour aromas banana citrus pine yeast spice the flavours bread citrus banana pine medium bitter lovely tasting bock the bitter an old style taste the finish best notes sweetness bitter spruce note a classic for a bock
Orangey yellow with a pale head. Aroma is earth, overripe stone fruit, quince, candied citrus. Light-medium bodied, fruity and bittersweet on the palate. Taste is fruity hops, stone fruit, quince.
Draft - Light banana notes. Cloudy gold with a small white head. Light banana and grass. Meh.

Oh, nothing like finding a beer named after everyones favourite parliament thug, Sir Jean! And is that Don Cherry, famous hockey goon, on the label? Better snap up a bottle of this before the lawyers have the remainder siezed! Poured a bit chilled at 4.0 degrees celcius, has fine creamy head and a very appetizing foggy banana body with no carbonation. Wheat notes with apricot and soft pear with bread. Has a nice banana flavour with sweet wheat beer notes and a smooth finish. Very well done, Id happily and get drunk on this and strangle protesters to celebrate Jeans inspiration to this brewery.

Très bonne Weizen. On goûte très bien la levure allemande qui fait ressortir le goût des bananes et de la brioche allemande. La robe est pêche et plutôt opaque. Un peu houblonnée quand même, elle se défend très bien dans son style. Un classique du TDD.
Bottle. Cloudy-yellow. Aroma: spicy yeast, fruits and malts. Taste: malts, yeast, fruits, spicy, a little madeira wine.
Golden color. Riped banana, bubblegum, cloves and some boozyness. Solid WBock.

On tap at ST Augustines in Vancouver. A peach coloured slightly cloudy beer with a bit of white head. Very pleasantly fruity nose. The taste is suggestive of pineapple and slightly of banana. A bit of spice, probably coriander as well. Nice. 3.7
More hops and less weizen with an appropriate placement of fruit flavours. Another amazing beer from an amazing brewery.

As usual with TDD, pretty much everything you need to know about this beer is in the description above. Bread dough, banana, spice and pine. Sweet, slightly sour, with a dry, slightly bitter finish. Aggressive carbonation. Good shyte.
Bottle. Fresh yeast and banana aromas. Pours with a cloudy golden hue and frothy white head. Yeast and banana flavours. Medium bodied with some bitter notes in the finish.

Pours a clouded golden topped by about two fingers of frothy white head showing good retention and lacing properties. The is yeasty, mostly, with some banana in the back. Some piny features come through. The taste is dominated by the yeasts and their fruity/piny aspects. Some breadiness noticed at the end. Very dry and foamy, with a medium body. Cheers!
Bottle. Cloudy, pale, golden, rocky head, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.

Pours a murky yellow-gold with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Very dry aroma of yeast, banana, other fruit and light sugary sweetness. Dry, yeasty flavour, a bit herbal and fruity. Medium bodied. Pretty good.

from la Mise en Bière - cloudy blond-orange beer with a long lasting white foam; aroma of wheat and banana, peaches; a good malt backbone and a fair carbonation; creamy palate, light salty and gently bitter; long wheaty and fruity (banana, apricots) finish

Style: weizenbock
Ibu: -
Description: une biere de couleur jaune paille, legere mousse peu de bulle/au nez banane et sapinage/ bonne biere de startup ressemble beaucoup a une hepfenweizen, tres legere amertume, bonne biere balancer

600ml bottle from Pasquier. Aroma : banana, cinnamon, Belgian yeast. App : hazy golden with medium white head. Taste and palate : medium body, light sweetness, lively carbonation, light bitter finish. Overall : a good representation of the style. Enjoyed the mix of banana and cinnamon in the aroma.
Very well balanced with that typical weizen yeast taste. Also, the label is one of the best I have ever seen.
This pours a cloudy pale yellow. Aromas of banana cream pie. Flavors are sweet and grainy. Rich banana. Very good stuff.

Aroma of coriander, banana, Belgian yeast and piney hops. Pours a peach colour, with a short lasting white head, cloudy with a bit of sediment. Slightly sweet taste of fruit, spice, pepper and malt. Medium body with a spicy finish.

Keg @ pizzeria paradiso. Lightnt Amber with a creamy white head. Bready. Some cake and pumpkin spice. Battenburg. Caramel. Flavor of pepper? Ginger cookie. Peaches. Wood. Angel food cake. Full body, strong carbonation. Decent.
On tap. Soft citrus, banana, coriander. Sweet and fairly full bodied flavour with a decent warmth. Quite nice!

Botella de 60 cl de el lúpulo tomada en el momento el 14-11-2014. Embotellada en 21-10-2013. color amarillento turbio con sabores y aromas algo herbáceos y cítricos. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber de 6.5 vol y algo de gas. No esta mal, normal.

Great label: mine differs from the photograph here but it has Chrétien choking Don Cherry. This beer is really unique. Very cloudy and honey golden in appearance. A great mixture of spice, citrus, and vanilla. An incredible beer.
Cloudy gold,white head.fruity,spicy yeast nose.Big spicy yeast palate with notes of bubblegum and peaches
Bottle brought back on my last Quebec trip. Poured a cloudy golden color with an averaged sized head. Fruity/bananas, some citrus, floral earthiness, and toasty.

I weizened up pretty quick to the merits of this handshake. This is what Rickards White wishes it was. The cloudy and opaque orange amber liquid smells of citrus, peach, wheat and basement. It is lightly bitter and mildly spicey with flavours of orange and wheat as well. A nice thick feel with a medium carbonated zip.

Bottle from a depanneur on Prince Arthur. It pours a lovely cloudy honey gold with a big soapy looking head. It has a big sweet bready aroma with banana and spices. It has a smooth soft mouthfeel. The taste is really pleasant spices, wheat, lemon, saison funk and a bit metallic. You gotta love the label.

I like how I never not what style a Trou I am drinking until I come on here. Never thought this was a weizen bock. Pours a hazy peach with small head. Aroma is of basement, peaches, and citrus. Tastes of peach, light banana, wheaty and floral. Was very smooth with a medium body and low carbonation. A very refreshing beer that was not too Belgiumy. Would most definitely buy again.

Bottle 600ml. @ home in garden. [ As Le Trou du Diable Shawinigan Handshake ].Unclear matt medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, sweet malt, moderate yeasty, sweet fruit, light banana - pineapple. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, wheat, yeasty, sweet fruit, sugary. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20140724]

600ml bottle. hazy golden color with white frothy head that keeps just a little lacing after a couple of minutes. tasty aromas of banana and medium sweetness. not much hops in the the nose. taste is awesome, banana and here you can feel the hops, perfect bitterness. mouthfeel is the best part, smooth and balanced. great dry, bitter finish . refreshing. tasty. awesome beer.
Maybe an off batch? Acetic aromas, very little hops and nearly invisible weizen yeast characteristics. Chinook is nearly undetectable. Thin mouthfeel. Sour finish. Extremely dissapointing.

Cor laranja e turva. Boa formação de espuma com boa persistência. No aroma, pêssego evidente, caramelo, cítricos ao fundo. No sabor, pêssego, frutas amarelas, com final seco e amargor com media persistência. De amargor médio e dulçor leve. Refrescante. Muito boa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is the best beer I know of, so I have to give it perfect marks. Pours a cloudy orange. Citrusy aroma. Perfect small fizz bubble mouthfeel. Crisp. Citrus and vanilla. I honestly don't know why I buy other beers when I drink this.

60 cl bottle.
Pours clear golden color with a large head. Some hops and apricot on the nose, mild wheat and banana with subtle spice notes. Apricot and wheat and wheat on the flavor, some earthy and spicy notes too. Medium carbonation, sourish finish. More like a Saison. A bit of a disappointment.
3334

600 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a white small head. Aroma of wheat, some citrus and some herbs. Flavour of caramel, grainy malts, some herbal notes, citrus and some overly ripe banana. Light bodied and thin mouthfeel. Alcohol warms. Does not taste like a weizen bock, more of a Saison or something. Weird.

60 cl bottle @ olio, bottled 21.10.2013
Aroma has some apricot tones and toffee. Flavour has strong apricot notes, some dried fruits and hints of grass. Finishes with slight herbal tones. More like blond Belgian ale than Weizenbock.

600ml bottle

Pours clear yellowish with a thick white head. Aroma of yeast, banana,  apricot, grass, hints of earthy notes and malts. Taste is sweetish, yeasty and spicy with some wheaty notes, apricot and banana. Finish is spicy, yeasty and earthy with some notes of banana. A bit strange.

375 ml bottle from the LCBO on clearance. Bottled about 13 months ago. Pours a hazy peach colour with a thin white head which doesnt last. Smells floral and fruity, malty, sweet bread, dough, honey, apples, plums, banana some molasses. Im tasting ginger bread and spices up front, slight bitter finish. Good beer.

Pours a pale, hazy gold with a bubbly, off white head. Powerful smell of bread, dough, banana, clove, and citrus. Taste is tart and citrusy, and fades into slightly bitter smoke and hop notes. Light, thin and lively carbonated body with bitter and astringent finish.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2014 Cloudy orange color with white long-persistent foam. Aroma is full of banana, clove, bubblegum, and spices. Taste is also rich in banana, clove ans spices such as pepper and cinnamon. Medium-bodied and also medium carbonation. Very balanced and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Very interesting Weizenbock.

A fresh, fruity tasting beer with a strong bitter-sweet taste that baffles the palate. You get cinnamon & cloves in spades.

Rated by BrewTom

Pours a cloudy straw with a foamy two finger white head diminishing gradually to a thin skim and moderate spotty lacing. Nose is very Belgian - lots of bananas, cloves, and bubblegum, with just a hint of cinnamon and spruce. Taste follows suite, with a distinct peppery bite. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation and a lingering off-dry finish.

This bottle had quite a bit of residue around the neck and cap, but it appeared to be just yeast, with no off flavours in the nose or taste. Definitely a characteristic weizenbock, with a strong clove character. Just as a little aside of Canadiana, the dude on the label looks nothing like the skater hippie who Chrétien actually throttled (the "Shawinigan handshake"), and actually bears a strong resemblance to Don Cherry.

600 ml bottle. Mostly clear golden yellow, white lasting foam. Aroma of coriander and citrus wit. Spicy citrus wit taste, lots of coriander, faint evergreen, big banana, even some cinnamon later on. Lively carbonation, light-medium bodied, lightly hopped. Nice enough. LBW (Lagerboys Be Wary)

Bottle at Bitter Tasting Room, Vancouver, 60cl, dated 200613Wow, this is served at North Pole temperatures, requires some waiting. Pours a hazy golden color, bright, with small compact head. The aroma slowly develops as the beer rests in the glass; strong spices, coriander majorly, cake dough, light lemon, some plastic and soap too, but all elegantly integrated. The mouthfeel is lean and smooth, medium-dry; the wheat flavor is present, very spicy too, coriander and bitter oranges; strong bitterness, long final with a good freshness.Lovely balance and harmony, and still, its a powerful beer.

Hazy light amber. Aroma has phenols, splash of alcohol, vague peat fruitiness and moderately doughy malts. Herbal, peachy fruits, more phenols, moderate hoppiness, touch of sweetness. Had to choke this down.

Sketchy review commin up. On tap at the Sugarbowl. 
Heavenly aroma - highly fragrant, semi whipped up pineapple cream, theres a bit more but Im happy with that description. Faint faint corriander, orange-lemon thing. Some typical wheat tasty things but topped off with soft citrus, but more subdued peppey spice. Bananas and hops. The kids are bored as shit. Time to leave.

500 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange yellow colour with a thick white head. Sweet aroma with notes of banana, citrus, caramel and some spice. Sweet flavour with caramel, spice, banana and a light bitter, alcohol finish. Medium body, creamy texture and lively carbonation.

Tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels. Hazy orange with a creamy head. Has a very similar aroma to the only other beer I tried from this brewery, that makes me think of candied fruit. Complex, moderately sweet and fruity taste with banana-like esteriness. In a rare moment of lucidity I managed to identify this as a weizen bock without knowing.

Color dorado con espuma blanca ligera. Aromas afrutados lupulados, ciruela verde, algo cítricos. En boca es libera y bastante carbonatada, aunque la textura es ligeramente aguada al final. Los sabores son muy afrutados, con un buen equilibrio entre los toques ácidos y dulces. Buena.
Opaque golden. grain, malt, light yeasty aroma. taste is sweet banana, yeat and nice hoppy bite.
bouteille de 660 ml de blonde. arome de pêche fruit de la passion. au gout on a un peu moins de parfum on a des notes de céréales

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 April 25, 2014: Pale yellow body. Malty aroma. Hoppy flavour. Like a hoppy saison or Belgian ale. Pretty nice. Go Preston manning. 
Re-Rate on tap Dec. 6. Much more banana this time around, more characteristic of a typical weizen bock, like a ramped-up hefeweizen. Better this time around. Upped rating.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass: 
Medium sized white creamy foamy head on top of a hazy yellow orange colored beer.
Aromas of wheat, some fruits like peach and banana, some yeast, cream, light bubble gum and some light apple tints.
Flavours of bitters, yeast, herbs, banana, malts, light creamy, light spicy, light citrus, some herbs and some bread. Nice.
Aftertaste is a mix of bitters, malts, yeast, light banana and some herbs.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, very good medium bodied and a creamy texture.
Quite basic but very good basic. Balanced and smooth.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: On tap @ Haven Gastropub. Hazy amber pour with a khaki head. Nice banana, bubblegum, and chocolate nose. Toasted bread, some clove, mild nutmeg, and raisin. A bit of a cola flavor to this beer. Plenty sweet with lots of caramel, raisin, and banana. Hints of chocolate, nutmeg, and a fair amount of clove. More bitter than Im used to from a weizenbock, or any German ale.

Bottled sample at cest what in Toronto. Spicy bubbly Orangey colour. Weizen bock. Abundantly drinkable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, bananig, fruchtig. Geschmack nach reifer Banane, hefig, fruchtig, leicht hopfig.

Draft at Saint Bock with Andrew, Rick, St, Bren and PJ. Pours a deep brown body with thin off white lacing. Aroma is light earth, nut, sweet rounded malt and spice. Mouthfeel is medium, not too much alcohol but some heat. Not bad.

Bière dorée avec une mousse blanche correcte. Liquide translucide, effervescent. Nez plutôt fruité de bananes, mais également de pain sucré : cela rappelle le parfum dune pâtisserie. En bouche, le goût de la banane sétiole quelque peu et laisse place à des notes plus herbeuses, plus astringentes. Le houblon Chinook amène une belle amertume qui nest pas très puissante. En résulte une bière accessible, franche, sèche. Cest un bon petit produit qui plaira à tous. Cheers!

600ml bottle. Hazy yellowish, deep golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Citrusy hoppy, fruity aroma, a yeasty touch, hints of apple, pear, banana, herbal overtones, a touch of spruce, some piss. Taste is slightly fruity, hoppy, herbal, hints of pear and spruce. Not exactly what Id expect from a Weizenbock, nevertheless with some nice fruity and herbal notes, relatively light and refreshing.
Hefiger, leicht fruchtiger Antrunk mit etwas zu starker Karbonisierung. Herber Mittelteil, die Hefigkeit rückt in den Hintergrund. Minimal alkoholischer, etwas hopfiger Abgang. 12/10/9/11/9/11

Hazy golden colour with a white head with good retention and medium lacework. Aroma has notes of yeast, cinnamon and slightly citrus hints. Flavor is moderate sweet at the beginning with notes of yeast, some wheaty notes and cinnamon,traces of banana are also present. The final presents a moderate bitterness wtih ripe banana notes.

Bottle to tulip
Aroma of lemon, wheat, fruity esters, cereal, and dough. Hazy yellow with a long lasting 1cm fluffy white head. Taste is apple, lemon, straw, pine, and ginger.

375ml bottle, with a hazy gold hue, and a pillowy white head, with a nice yeasty light banana fruity, ripe apple, doughy nose, with a faint apple strudel dough, vanilla, cinnamon, clove spicy note, with some wheat, pale, toasted malt, panettone cake dough, peach, coriander, curaçao peel, honey accents in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good yeasty, doughy, spicy, fruity, light flowery citrus, leafy hop character, with some apple sauce, apple strudel dough, faint vanilla, banana puréed, ripe apple, cinnamon, vanilla, clove, wheat, pale, toasted malt, banana bread flavours, leading towards a yeasty, doughy, banana, ripe apple fruitiness, vanilla, light cinnamon, clove spiciness, lingering pale, toasted, wheat maltiness finish.
Tap at red light... Light hazy amber... Small white head... Soft fruits.. Sift sweet banana... Dry zezty fruits... Light tart. Banana... Light bitter finish

375ml bottle. Hazy honey colour with a thin foamy white head. Aroma is wheat, dough, banana, pine, cloves, cinnamon and bubblegum with floral notes. Taste is wheat, grapefruit, banana and honey. Medium body, lively carbonation, smooth and creamy texture.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is banana, clove, peach, sugar, and wheat. Taste is somewhat sweet. It seemed a little bit on the light side to be a weizenbock. However, it was tasty and did show some veritable complexity.

Couleur de pèche avec un col moyen beige/blanc. Larôme est des épices et banane. Cest aussi un peu fruité. Dabord le goût est des épices, banane et un peu du malt puis une amertume en finale plus forte qhabitude pour le style.

Bière jaune orangée, voilée, bonne effervescence, et surmontée dun col moyen, blanc, mousseux et dense, qui se réduit tranquillement. Arômes de pain frais, blé, pâtisserie, léger miel, avec dabondants effluves fruités (banane, agrumes, fruits tropicaux, poire). Outre lagrume, le houblon apporte quelques notes florales au nez, et une certaine odeur typique de la levure à weizen est également perceptible. Le nez est intéressant, complexe et intense. En bouche, la bière est pétillante et bien mousseuse, mais elle est également très mince au palais. Au goût, on retrouve un peu de pain frais en entrée de bouche, mais autrement, le houblon domine totalement. Contrairement à ce que le nez laissait présager, le houblon est plutôt résineux, avec quelques notes dagrumes et dananas. Lamertume est moyennement élevée. Cette bière, définitivement une hopweizen et non pas une weizen bock, nest pas du tout sucré en bouche, et presque pas fruité par rapport à son nez. Selon moi, ça en fait un breuvage aux saveurs déséquilibrées, manquant définitivement de richesse et de complexité en bouche. Il faut dire que les hopweizens, ce nest pas mon fort. Je reconnais quil sagit néanmoins dune bonne bière.
ADORÉE!!!!!!! :D Bananes à souhait!

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 Plutôt trouble et de couleur dorée, une bonne mousse blanche sestompe après quelques lampées. Un bouquet très floral et fruité, gracieuseté du houblon Chinook et de la levure allemande, caractérise cette bière au goût complexe de fruits (pêche, banane) et de houblons procurant un côté sapineux et herbacé à la bière. Une vive effervescence frétille le palais et une amertume dont on ne sattendait pas au départ complète la marche. Un bon produit du Trou du Diable qui vaut le détour juste pour sa magnifique étiquette!

Draft @ Lord Hobo. Hard to see the color of this beer is such a poorly lit room. But I can see it has a nice cap of bubbly head. Solid retention. Light yeast aspects of clove, bubblegum and hints of caramel covered bananas. Flavor brings out tons of wheat, some clove, again caramel fruits and some dry spicy herbs. Light  medium in body. I was hoping for a more traditional German wheat Bock, this is something a bit different. More like a lighter hefeweizen. Flavor is good and easy enough to drink.
Bottle from the SAQ. Pours a nice golden orange colour with medium head that quickly dissipates. Aroma of fruits, spices. Taste is spices, some banana. Very good beer.
Very pale amber color. Very light body, a touch of bananas, a touch of astringency. Lively carbonation, moderate  finish. Enjoyable, but nothing complex.

Bottle. Hazy orange-gold, thick dense white head. Soft yeasty esters and zippy hop character define this beer in equal proportion. Very much a hopfenweiss in my mind, so drinkable, such lovely flavours. Will have to get more of this...
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle, many bottles. My assumption was that this would be a generic beer capitalizing on the label and name. WRONG. A great beer. Cloudy amber. Thick head and lace. Nice spicy aroma. Big hops and a big yeast profile that rolls over and over again down the length of the tongue. Goes from possibly weird, somewhat intriguing to addictive.

600 ml bottle. Pours a clear gold with huge white head that settles quickly. Aromas of resin, dried bananas, cloves, cinnamon, and a touch of sulphur. Flavors of bitter resin and green bananas with a mixture of spices that follow through to the finish but throw off the balance.

600 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours ruddy orange-amber with a moderate white head that remains and leaves a moderate amount of loose lace. On the nose, there are notes of pale malt, wheat, coriander, banana, peach, citrus, pepper and spruce. The flavour is slightly sweet up front with peach, banana, pale malts and big peppery, spicey notes that increase towards the end. Moderate hop bitterness picks up on the tail end. Spruce comes through in the finish, which is also peppery, spicey and herby with increasing hop bitterness. On the palate, it is medium in body with a milky, slightly dry texture. Overall, this is a nice weizen bock with loads of spice, fruity esters and a nice amount of hops. 2013-06-22
Aromas of banana, clove and spice come through. Flavours are the same with a nice citrus, but not bitter, taste lingering. Bubbly carbonation. Quite good.

Sample, 4-ounce, during the Bières et saveurs, savoured on August 30 2013; eye: caramel with an orangey hue, no effervescence, tiny ring of off-white head, slight lacing; nose: hops, pine, citrusy, grapefruit, light tangerine; mouth: hops, pine, citrusy, grapefruit, light tangerine, light banana, light alcohol, dry finale in grain with presence of banana, medium-full body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, lightly harsh texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, en fût, 4 onces, lors du Bières et saveurs, savourée le 30 août 2013; il : caramel avec une teinte orangée, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé, très légère dentelle; nez : houblon, pin, citrique, pamplemousse, léger tangerine; bouche : houblon, pin, citrique, pamplemousse, léger tangerine, léger banane, léger alcool, finale sèche en grain avec présence de banane, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, moyennement amère, texture légèrement rugueuse; en résumé : bien

My favorite bottle graphic. Pours a huge frothy white head and cloudy orange body. Nose of bubblegum and yeasty, some Irish malt may be lurking. Great carbonation and malt, spice and yeastiness. Dare I say this is Orval-like? I really dig this.

(Draught at Brydens, Toronto, Nov 29 2013) Pours a completely clouded medium orange with brownish hints, small white cap of fine bubbles, no lace. Aroma is banana from the yeast, slight bubblegum sweetness, mild spice and a bit of wet conifer needle from the hops. Flavour has pale malt sweetness, some banana, wet grass, quite yeasty. Towards the finish it dries out, pine needles/resin, light spicebox, yeasty. Body is medium-light, carb heavy and aggressive. This isnt bad by any means, but it is not the best hoppy weizen either, and I feel the use of Chinook to play up the conifer aspect rather than more fruity hops to work with the yeast wasnt the best decision.

De couleur Dorée-Orangée avec un col mousseux qui se dissipe quand même assez rapidement. Nez de fruit et dépices. En bouche arôme subtil de fruit comme la banane et épice en finale une amertume moyenne. Très bonne bière complexe.

Part of a tap flight at BierCraft. Cloudy orange, solid white cap, steady lacing. Aroma of bananas, straw, more bananas then sweet bananas and bubble gum. Taste is straw, banana, spices. Good balance of malt and dry finish.
Pas mauvaise mais bien trop acidulée et ne ressemble pas vraiment à son style. Plus près dune Saison...
Sample, wow I thought this was a saison, great brew, yeast is in the foreground, tasty stuff

Pours a solid gold with a thin fizzy white cap that leaves behind good lacing. The aroma is lemon zest, mint, spice, bananas, yeast, floral and spicey hops. The flavour is spicey, light banana and yeast, medical, and spicey hops. Well constructed, but I feel it could do with a better malt profile.

La bière est dun rouge-orangé voilé. Bien gazéifiée. Ça sent un peu le conifère et la banane. Cest épicé, style clou de girofle ou cannelle. Mais arrive une généreuse amertume qui sestompe en fraîcheur. Watatow.

Not really a weizen bock as categorized here, more of a strong dark rural ale with some wheat, a bit of a hybrid style. Nice deep malt flavour with the wheat noticeable but not overpowering. Well hopped though the malt flavour dominates and counteracts most of the hop bitterness. It has a strong taste and certainly fits its description as a pugnacious strong ale.
bière orangée voilée,arôme dagrumes et dépice.En bouche,goûte lépinette et un côté un peu épicé.

Aroma:banana wheat aroma...
Appearance:hazy cooper ,light lacing head..
Flavor:wheat banana flavor mixed whit light hopy note,,,,

First Trou du Diable at the LCBO. Pours a cloudy yellow-amber colour with lots of particles floating. Big white frothy head, very long lasting and with loads of patchy lacing. The wheat and banana notes come out at first, but then, the hop takes over. It also is quite present in the taste, creating a decent dry mouthfeel with some nice bitterness. Grassy flavours with some fruity malts in the background. A nice brew that has the wheat of a Hefe and the hoppiness of an American IPA.

Bouteille de 375ml achetée aux Délires du Terroirs. Couleur blonde orangée, avec mousse légère mais omniprésente et longue dentelle. Odeur de houblon floral, blé, pain, épices. Goût de blé et houblon très prononcé. Effervescence élevé, palais moyen. Bière un peu légère pour une Weizen Bock, on ne ressent pas vraiment lalcool...

Clear peach coloured with thick, white head. Aroma is resin, spice, a little fruitiness (others are saying banana, but Im not quite there), bready malts, some yeast and just the right amount of sweetness. Body is medium with slightly more than average dry carbonation. Taste is as suggested in the aroma with a pleasant dry finish.

bottle from metro colin A: bready, piny, a touch of clove, pleasant spiciness . app: hazy cooper small white head, good lacing. t/p: med body light bitter finish. some warming from the spiciness. o: super good. im surprised its hoppy but blend well with the spiciness from the yeast.

Bottle: Poured a deep copper color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma consists of citrus and floral hops from the Chinook are dominant. Taste is also dominated by the hoppy notes form the Chinook with some citrus and floral notes. Body is about average with good carbonation. I thought this was an APA all along; the hops level overshadows the wheat notes.

Pours a fairly thick cloudy golden orange, and an average sized dull white head leaving spots of lace on the glass. Aroma is banana, clove, bready/wheaty, I see how someone could say cinnamon bun after reading it but it wouldnt be something I came up with because I dont think its very distinct. Flavour is spicy cloves, mild bitterness, bready(wheat), light banana compared to the aroma, and a bit of a malty sweetness in the mix. Im liking this, its quite interesting and well made.

Thanks to cfrancis for this. Pours a cloudy orangish color with a frothy white head and tons of lacing(a ring with each sip). Aroma of banana, clove bread, yeast and slight resin. Taste is banana, clove, cereal up front with the Chinook hops dominating the finish with a taste of pure resin. Pleasant bitterness on the finish. Basically a German hefe up front that transform into a Chinook ipa with a few specialties in between.

600ml bottle. Pours a hazy honey colour with a one finger head of fine off-white bubbles. The nose has a light hint of Juicy Fruit bubblegum, light cereal notes, black pepper, yeast, and light resinous notes. The taste begins with some banana/yeasty notes, light pepper, and then lightly resinous, mineral heavy hops that last all the way until the end, with some light romaine lettuce notes in the finish. This is a well made beer, and you can tell that some serious care went in to it. It would be a great beer if they dialed down the hops a little bit though, and let the Belgian blonde-like notes shine through.

une bière orangé voilée avec un beau collet de broue. Au nez, vous constaterez une bière forte avec plusieurs saveurs qui vous surprendront par un assemblage parfait. La finale est douce et agreable ne bouche. Une excellente bière que je qualifierais de valeur sure.
600 ml bottle. Very good beer. Some belgian influence. Nice spice and sweetness. Not too rich. Very approachable. Would drink again.
Blonde orangé. Beau collet dense. Nez: fruité. Acide. Épice. Bouche: sucré. Fruité (jaune). Légère acidité non déplaisante. Fine amertume verte. Un peu végétale. Céréale. Épicé. Beau corps. Bien.

600mL bottle, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike), pours a hazy golden with a small white head. Nose brings out floral notes, a little wheat, some banana, and clove. Flavour brings out loads of wheat, some clove, a touch of banana, and some dry citrusy hops. Pretty dry and lifeless, with dominating notes of clove and wheat. Pretty simplistic and boring, but decent enough. Okay.

Cloudy golden orange pour with large frothy white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, pine and caramel. Taste of malt, slight caramel, faint wheat, grapefruit and hops. Highly carbonated. Hops overpower any weizen bock characteristics on this one, too bad, more of an IPA.

Bottle was a gift from Guillaume! Cheers! Pours a cloudy orange with a sparse white head. Full Appearance points for the label alone. Aroma: Orange, hay, grapefruit. Palate: Medium bodied, fizzy, long finish. Taste: sweet start, slightly bitter finish. Kind of feels like something is grabbing at my throat!

600ml bottle. Pours a clouded orange with a one finger, frothy, white head with some slight sediment. Leaves slight lacing. Aroma has notes of orange and lemon citrus, pepper, yeast, and sugar.Taste is a slight bitter with a spiced peppery/citrus aftertaste. Medium body and aftertaste with a bubbly, frothy mouth feel.A nice, refreshing brew! Would buy again.

Cloudy orange-brown, no sediment, slightly carbonated and generous head and lace. Pungeant hop and yeast to the nose, musty earthen esthers and mold. Flavor is bold and crisply bitter with raw plantain notes and a dry lasting finish. Quite bubbly in mouth and refreshing. Was always a little shy with belgian style beers cant say this will break the spell.

Neat little 600ml bottle into a Stella glass. Hey, dont judge me; its all I had that was clean. The bottle art is delightful, which may have influenced me a bit more in my choice of beer tonight than I am willing to let on. What can I say; I loved Jean from the moment he told off the US on going to war in Iraq. Anyway, this is a beer rating, not a political whinging area. Bottle to the glass. Pours a cloudy amber with a foamy head that quickly degrades to a faint lacing. Nose is a nice wad of hops with a backing of what I can only describe as Belgian; that kind of sweet, spicy scent that you tend to only fine in an Abbey offering. Being a Belgian fanatic, this is appealing. Tasting. Oh my; nice hit of citrus and hops, balanced with a delightful sweetness, and that kind of spicy Belgian flavour. Did they use Belgian yeast with this? I would swear they did, and added some coriander just to help me along. Well balanced, with the sweetness and tartness playing against one another for a very nice finish. This is a top-end beer, and very much worth keeping an eye out for.

750ml bottle. Big head, amber brown, totally unfiltered, large particulate. Aroma was fruity, yeasty, spicy. Almost smelled like mustard to me. Taste was fruity, tart, wheat, yeast and still some of that weird spice. Body felt ok, particulate wasnt noticeable in the mouthfeel. Overall, not my favourite weizen but interesting.

Pours hazy copper with a foamy white head. Aroma of banana, bubble gum, orange peel, a bit of resin - really nice. Taste is typical hefeweizen-sweet up front, with some slight acidity noticeable afterward and some sticky hops in the finish, evenly balancing the sweetness. Really quite excellent.

Orangée et très voilée, une mousse avec une légère teinte de jaune, mais presque blanchâtre. Nez de blé et de banane et dagrumes. En bouche, cest du blé, des agrumes et des épices avec une fin un peu sèche.

2013/08/08 - Pours a cloudy yellow orange colour with a small, fizzy white head that reduces quickly to a constant surface film. Aroma is yeast, sweet cereal malts, banana and pine resin. Taste is similar to nose; cereal and banana up front with a finish of cloves and piney hops. Mouthfeel is medium with effervescent and stinging carbonation and a bitter/peppery aftertaste. Very nice. A refreshing and well balanced summer beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I love this beer. Banana, clove and pine in the nose. Decent lacing, but minimal head. I won't tell you the colour as I am enjoying this beer in a dimly lit spot. The bottle is from the LCBO, mine poured fairly clear but it has been undisturbed in my fridge for about a week, and it was a careful pour. A fantastic dry finish and the hops throughout the flavour are perfect for those who enjoy a mouthful of freshness. I'd stock up on this if the hop presence weren't so important. A great summer beer that is drinking well now!

600 ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha, served quite cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Cloudy dirty amber with floaties and a fair yellowish-tan head.
 
Aroma: Really nice resinous, pungent, slightly fruity hops, a bit soapy, kinda floral, the esters are there, but are over-shadowed, slightly metallic, some wheat and yeast character, also over-shadowed, citrus/lemon, a little peppery, I think, quite hop-forward for the style!
 
Palate: Medium body, fine, fairly full effervescence.
 
Flav.: The esters come through a little more here, still plenty of hop character, still slightly metallic, wheat/cereal, odd; dry with good bitterness and a nice boiled cereal/wheat and resinous hop finish.

Weizenbock? Really?? Great label, nice hop aromas/flavours. Weizenbock???

Bière blonde orangée de 6.5 % dalcool. Elle possède un odorat de bière brune et de feu de bois. Elle possède un beau col au versement. On goûte une certaine amertume en finale, tout en possédant un goût mystérieux, du type goût de blé. Cependant, on le goûte très bien. Une tendance à gouter la coriandre également. Correcte !

Pours an unclear orange with no head and thus no lacing (wtf?). Aroma is nice with banana dominating followed by cloves and a little pine. Taste is dry-ish with a tart quality, not sour or acid but feeling like it. More banana bread and cloves in the flavor department. Carbonation is quite aggressive and it makes the drink feel a bit watery at times. Overall a decent weizenbock, one that I could come back to on occasions.

Bottle from LCBO. Lightly hazy, orange-yellow pour with quick white head. Aroma of bread, yes banana, clove, pine, pineapple and pepper. Beautiful balanced complexity. Medium and slightly chewy. Caramel maltiness with a banana bread sweetness. Finally a medium finish with pepper and slight pine bitterness. ABV well hidden. Very nice!

Bouteille 600ml. Couleur orangée trouble, mousse blanc cassé aérienne et crémeuse. Arôme de levure, banane, céréales. Goût de banane, levure, caramel, blé, houblon floral, légère amertume. Carbonation moyenne, corps moyen, légèrement crémeux.

clear amber pour, with a big white head. 
tropical aroma, mango, some pear, even a touch of pineapple. Light yeasty notes, some banana, hints of clove. very lively mouthfeel and carbonation. the finish is medium to high on the bitterness scale. slight malts, and grains in the finish, with more mango, and some grassy hops. i did a double take when i saw the listed style.......im a little confused.
Hazy orange pour with a frothy white head and lace. Banana and clove aroma. Nice texture, smooth with a tangy finish. Flavour of banana, clove and sweet melon. Tasty beer.

Bottle - 600ml. Cloudy golden body with average carbonation and a thick, fading off-white frothy head. Fresh malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty, coriander, candy, and banana hints. Taste is slightly dominated by hoppy flavors. It carries strong coriander notes, as well as piney, citrusy and some spicy ones. Ends with a sharp, long, robust bitter/herbal finish. Good stuff.

Spicy, belgian yeast aroma, with some citrus notes and a slight sweetness. Hazy hazy yellow almost pink apperance with long lasting white head. Taste is sweet upfront with a bit of citrus, the belgian character comes out in the middle and a long spicy and slightly hoppy finish that builds over time. Medium bodied and average carbonation. Quite a refreshing summer beer and has some complexity to back it up. Pretty nice.

Pours a hazy straw colour with a thick pillowy white head, aroma is complex with notes of banana, spices, and some citrus. The tasting notes are complex as well, with notes of banana, citrus, coriander, and a spicy/hoppy finish. This is an amazing beer, and I really enjoyed it! I will have to pick up a few more!

Hazy pour, gold, big head that left big rings of lace. Aroma of banana and spice, getting some hops as well. Taste - Yeast, banana, clove, spicey, and they the hops kick in. Medium body, lighter carbonation. I really enjoyed this.

600mL lickbo bottle. Pours a very hazy yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is decent, better than I expected (Ive been really not in the mood for wheat ales for about the past 25 years). Nice hop presence although thats a background character, complimenting the malt body and fresh citrus esters. Flavour is also quite nice, spritzy upfront with some citrus acidity, followed by moderate pale malts and a somewhat dry finish. Not a lot of wheat malt character, I think thats why I like it. The yeast is also quite tame, as well as the carbonation, which I really appreciate. A nice tribute to Chretien.

Bière orangée, voilée et effervescente. Nez fruité (orange, banane...) avec un peu dépices. Pétillante et herbacée en bouche, cette bière présente des agrumes et de lamertume en finale (quelque chose comme du pamplemousse.) Une belle bière de terrasse... ou dintérieur. Comme les minous finalement!

Dark amber brew with a small head that dissipates rapidly. Malty, spicy aroma with a malty (slightly) sweet taste that is quickly overtaken by a nice bitterness that doesnt linger for too long. Very drinkable for such a strong beer. A fine tribute to our 20th Prime Minister.

pour ma centieme biere cote c est une qui vient de chez nous ou je suis ne de shawi. de couleur dore avec une legere col qui dure un peu on sens des arome resineux qui est tres present. en bouche on n aun cote fruit de banane avec le houblon chinook qui est rtres résineux et goute beaucoup en bouche une belle réussite (rate 100)

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2014 Bouteille 660 ml. Couleur dorée, un peu voilée, mousse blanche. Arôme de banane, levures et un peu dherbe. En bouche, bananes et agrumes cèdent la place aux grains et au houblon résineux. Finale houblon et un peu amère. Bel équilibre. Très bonne.

Très trouble, couleur jus de pêches, le nez est en agrumes et en bananes, la levure allemande soutenant les houblons dès lentrée en matière. Le tout se transporte en bouche, où le liquide, bien moelleux, est explosif en saveurs : le Chinook ajoute du piquant et du dynamisme, donnant des relents de saison à une weizen complexe et pourtant bien dans les règles de lart. Exemple assez accessible dun style qui peut parfois savérer très costaud, elle est tout de même délicieusement agréable. Encore un bon coup de TDD.

Une bière trouble la mousse disparait rapidement couleur agréable.Odeur de fruit. Belle effervescence en bouche. Équilibre entre le fruit et le sucre réussi. Manque de punch je mattendais à plus.En finale, jai un gout deau et de fruit. Mention honorable pour létiquette et son histoire. Pour moi,quon aime ou non le personnage cette bière ne ressemble pas au caractère de lhomme quelle représente.
Pours just slightly clouded light amber with light white head that fades quickly. Aroma is sharp with floral, bubblegum-like spices. Taste is heavy sweet like a strong Belgian wit.

600ml brown bottle. Hazy gold pour, some floaties. Sturdy and thick white head, good staying power and big lace rings. Nose has some banana and yeast and bread notes. Taste has bread, honey, grain and wheat with some banana and grassy hops. Bitter finish, lasting grass and spicy yeast with a bit of earth. Crisp and tight carbonation, light mouthfeel. Overall a nice fresh and hoppy beer, very crisp and light in the summer sun, the Chinook hops really do a lot for this beer.
Pours a hazy orange with medium size head and serious lacing. Aromas of banana and apricot. Dry beer with yeasty character. Bitter finish. Tasty.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours hazy golden with low white head. Aroma is of bananas, yeast, sugar, fruits, some pine. Taste is of wheat, bitterness, some bananas, yeast. Palate: Ligth-medium body. Overall: Surprisingly bitter. This is not a beer I enjoy that much. Hopping seems bare, naked to me, especially the finale. Still decent.

Bottle from the LCBO. Orange-yellow body with a fairly hazy appearance and a couple of fingers of snow white head. Nice aroma of tropical fruit cocktail (pineapple, mango, banana) with a bit of pine and some peppery yeast. Flavour is big and hoppy as expected from this hybrid style, with the German and American influences meshing well, especially in the long and dry/bitter finish. Body is a bit fuller and stickier than I like from a wheat beer - even one as big as this.
600ml bottle from the LCBO. hazed blonde with a white head. clashing american hops and german style wheat ale. i dont need to try this combo again, it just never works for me.

600 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a murky burnt orange with dense, lasting white head and a few little floaties. Aroma is burnt banana, wheat, light spice and gentle spruce. Flavour is toasty banana, apple, wheat, clove, pepper and spruce. Moderate bitterness in finish.
Bottle from LCBO. Pours hazy amber with a bubbly white head. Aroma of banana, other fruits, and light spice. Taste is banana, spice, then pine and a bitter finish. Good stuff.

Pours a cloudy light orange with a thick white head and very nice lacing. Aroma has banana, pine, light citrus, a little bit of spices. Taste has a good weizen-like profile but with a piney and a little citrusy note, a bit peppery, good malt presence, little sweetness. Medium body and medium carb. I remember the last bottled batch to be more hoppy and citrusy than this one but this is still very good.

600 mL bottle. Pours a very cloudy peach nectar color with a splotchy white head. Leaves some serious lacing. Aromas of apricot, banana, baking bread and piney hop. Bone dry with a hint of yeasty tartness, bright and fragrant; full carbonation and light to medium body. A lingering fruitiness and hop bite on the tongue. Very good, dangerously drinkable.

I met our 20th prime minister once, but only in passing, and didnt get a "Shawinigan Handshake". I can only imagine this is better. 12 oz pour at Beer Revolution in a quasi-tulip glass. Nose is pastry shop, banana, and a mild floral note. Bold and medium-full bodied for 6.5%, medium alcohol warmth. Medium-heavy carbonation, quite bubbly golden pour with white cap. Mouthfeel is clean, taste is banana, nice yeasty kick, finishes perfect with a hint of pine needles and resin, but not off-putting. Wicked beer.

600ml bottle. Hazy orange body, medium white head with good retention and plenty of lacing. A very interesting aroma: a mix of a Belgian ale and an American IPA; strong yeast, grapefruit, caramel, orange, caramel, strong floral notes, bananas. Refreshing taste: apricots, caramel, sweet malts, good amount of herbal hops, yeast, spices. Lovely.

Pours dark orange with a cap fluffier than a liberal election promise. On the other hand, if this beer were named after our current PM itd be blander than a molson product & flatter than an accountant at a staff party. But damn if this aint a good a beer & like a typical liberal it steals a little from the left (that promising fruity tropical meets banana taste) and from the right (an austerity bitterness that any neo-con could get behind). Complex, brisk & a great drink. Drink a couple of these & you too can write some witty political metaphors.

Ive had this on tap before but the bottle is worth the buy for the label alone - there you will see, frozen in time. the famous Shawinigan handshake (a greeting our ex PM saved for anyone who disagreed with him) - like our ex-PM s thinking this is a cloudy ale - light gold with 2 finger puffy cap. Unlike our ex-PMs dealings, nothing funny smelling about this wheat ale - ripe apricot, banana, clove and other spice, a hint of sweetness and dusty wheat malts. Also unlike our ex-PM there is no poor taste here - Big on fruit tastes and sharply hopped, robust malt backbone - goes lightly dry and bitter in the finish with a nice hop bite at the end, Unlike the little guy from Shawinigan this is a welcome export of that locale.

600 mL bottle. Outstanding label. Hazy orange-gold with suspended sediment, and a big, sticky, off-white head. Interesting aroma for the style, with the typical notes, but also with some resin and orange from American hops. The flavour is a little thinner than expected, and the hop bitterness overwhelms the yeast and wheat a bit. Certainly an interesting brew; just wish it were a little fuller.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy pale gold with a good amount of off-white head that dissipates quickly and leaves some nice lacing. Smell is apple, pear, banana, a bit of pine/spruce hops, and a good amount of malty sweetness, though lighter than caramel almost. Palate is medium bodied with slightly lacking carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet at first but quickly gets bitter, the sweetness catches up again but the finish and aftertaste are both quite dry and slightly bitter. Pretty good, but flavour seems a bit rough.

600ml bottle pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light banana and citrus.  Taste is a light spruce and spicy bitterness with a grainy malty sweetness.  Medium bodied with some good carbonation.  Not really sure what style this brew is, bottle says pugnacious strong ale, ratebeer states Weizen Bock, whatever, this is a truly fantastic beer that I recommend others to try.

Draught at TdD Tap Takeover, Wvrst, May 26. Pours a murky yellow-gold with an average size semi-lasting frothy white head. Very dry aroma of yeast, banana, other fruit and light sugary sweetness. Dry, yeasty flavour, a bit herbal and fruity. Medium bodied. Pretty good.

Tap at Wvrst. Muddy/dank pour. Tight white head. The aroma is very interesting. Peach and citrus with a bit of fruity/estery character. Assertive hoppiness that works well with the base beer. Fruity and juicy with a lingering juicy finish. Quite lovely really. A bit of clove and peach.

Bottle 500 ml at Volo 
Aroma sweet , fruity berry like feel. Hint of apricot. 6+
 Appearance  hazed amber , frothy top with some lace. 3+
Flavor and Palate :  Medium bodied, oily with interesting berry like tartness. Mellow follow up. Easy going  with fruity vibe. Drinkable.

Pretty good beer from a style I love. Pours clear copper with extra appearance points for creamy head, some lacing. Aromas of booze, yeast and some sweet malt. Some floral hops as well. Medium to thick consistency. Carbonation slightly below average. Taste just a touch of boozy sweetness and eve less sourness. Well balanced and good, though not among best weizenbocks Ive had.

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée chez La Barik (Trois-Rivières, QC). Arôme: Odeur de banane avec une pointe dhoublon. Apparence: La couleur est cuivrée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de bananes et dhoublons avec une pointe dépicess. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #4408)

500ml. bottle fromSaucisserieB.A.M. in Ste-Rose Laval.The color is a hazy orange amber with a nice off-white head an lace.The aroma is sweet and floral and herbs.The taste also of herbs with a nice hoppyness to it, also some barley. All in all a nice dry and pleasing beer to drink and the bottle was fun to look at.

Bouteille de 500ml avec une étiquette remarquable. Bière dorée foncée avec une fine couche de mousse. Les arômes de bananes sont bien présents au nez. Il y a une bonne couche de houblon herbeux. La bouche est ferme avec du blé qui ne se laisse pas impressionné par les houblons. La finale est sèche et digeste. Une bière agréable que je ne manquerai pas de reboire.

Oktoberfest des Québécois 2012 - Bière dorée, légèrement trouble et coiffée dun épais col mousseux laissant une belle dentelle au verre.  Des arômes originaux de pâte à pain, de feuilles mortes sur un filet dalcool.  Belle amertume.  De corps honnête, elle est lisse, bien effervescente et se termine sur une finale tout en amertume.

Sampled at the GCBF. Advertised as "the best of a hefeweizen crossed with the best of an IPA" or some such...

Very very clear for either style, really. Little to no head. Smell is all hefeweizen. Taste is mild bitterness. Finish is half/half. Best of hefeweizen is the banana/clove cross. Best of IPA is the overpowering stench of hops. This has neither. Inoffensive, but misses the point.



Welp, thats what I wrote, based upon my interpretation of how their beer matches the description. I see here that its labelled a weizenbock so I feel pretty dumb... but I probably would have had a similar review anyhow, as I didnt pick up phenols or esters in this beer.

Cette bière est dune couleur qui me donne de la difficulté à décrire. Létiquette dit "couleur pêche", moi je la vois ni blonde, ni ambrée, ça ressemble plus à de labricot séché. Sa mousse est dense et persistante. Le nez est agréablement sollicité par des odeurs de fruits: dagrumes, dabricots qui se joignent à des effluves dépices. La bouche nous envoie des signaux damertume et en attendant une réaction elle sinstalle confortablement. Un zeste dorange cogne à  la porte. Est-ce quelle était trop vieille, mal entreposée, ou avais-je le goût dérangé ce jour-là? Parce que je nai perçu pratiquement aucun des éléments de la description. Cest assez bon et moyen. (279-280612)
Bottle at Barhop.  A weizen bock is only part of the story, fresh and well hopped.  Banana and hops, lots of fruitiness. Fuller mouthfeel. lasting head and thick looking.

[4438-20120602] Bottle. Spiced hot veggie malt aroma. Clear, amber orange body with a quick foamy off-white head. Sweet malty pepper flavour has a bit of a toasted pineapple finish. Medium body. Interesting, a little bitter. (6/3-/7/3/14) 3.3
(An Afternoon with TdD @ Wvrst, Toronto, ON)

2012-06-02. Crisp dark amber body with a small off-whit head. 3+ Mild aroma, light malt, light spice, light alcohol. 7+ Flavour is similar, mild sweet malt base, modest spices are pleasant throughout, light bitterness, mild bready biscuity accents. 7+ Smooth average plus palate. 7+ Pretty nice, it might score a point or two higher on a different day, as the spice profile was not entirely what I was in the mood for today. 3+ Sample from bottle at Wvrst, Toronto

500ml bottle from doubled77. Cloudy amber with a creamy tan head that fades relatively quickly to a thin layer. Wheat, some grass, banana and light spices. Taste reminded me more of a Fantome beer - high carbonation, light body, some light funk with a floral bitterness and barnyard appeal, becomes very dry with more banana and spice coming out at the end.
yeasty aroma, belgian esters, nutmeg and banana. has a leafy bitter notes mixed in with cereal and yeast. very tasty stuff.
On tap. Foggy, yellowish with a resilient white head. Tastes like bananas and cloves. Light and fruity, not much bitterness. Medium-bodied. Pretty good!

Bottle 500 ml. Pours amber with lasting white head. Almost no lacing. Aroma is mostly of cereal (wheat) and fruits (bananas and peaches). Taste is well blanced, with just enough bitterness.
Boutelle 500 ml. Robe ambrée avec un collet blanc ersistant. Pratiquement pas de "lacing". Aromes de céréales (blé) et fruits (bananes et pêches). Goût bien balancé, avec une bonne amertume.

Bottle 500 ml [2012]. Appearance: Pours cloudy golden whit a nice off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma: Banana, citrus, yeast. Taste: Banana, spruce and citrus. Light bitter finish. Overall: Well balanced and refreshing.

Bouteille de 500 ml. Arômes de levure de weizen (surtout des bananes). Houblon résineux en second plan. Robe orangée et trouble, petite mousse disparaissant assez rapidement et effervescence assez active. En bouche, le houblon résineux et mentholé est plus présent quau nez, mais demeure équilibré par les esters fruités de la levure. Le malt montre un caractère légèrement caramélisé et moyennement rond. Finale montrant une amertume dintensité moyenne et une pointe dacidité. Lalcool demeure peu apparent. Intéressant et agréable à boire.

(50 cl)  Un liquide à la robe cuivrée.  Une tête qui laisse une dentelle éparse.  Un nez qui senroule autour deffluves de banane et malts doux.  Un parfum dherbes qui souvre au fil de la dégustation.  Des houblons verdoyants.  Un caractère épicé qui évite à peine lévincement.  Des saveurs qui débutent avec une douceur maltée et qui évoluent vers des herbes amères et des fleurs asséchantes.  Une très fine présence de la banane.  Le blé et son caractère acidulé accompagne bien le profil amérisant des cultivars.  Une sensation en bouche qui porte la signature de la maison.  Un pétillement juste et une texture huileuse.  Une finale qui combine lexpression aromatique de la levure et lamertume de houblons verts et poivrés.  Appréciable.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2013 Une bière de blé bananesque rapidement complémenté par le caractère des houblons plus sapinés que fruités. Elle se boit doucement et ne brusque pas le palais. Sa finale poivré et terreuse rehausse le profil.

In short: A big blond wheat ale with a mild banana & spicy character.  Good beer
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Cloudy golden blond body topped by a persistent small white head
In long: Nose has some herbal spiciness and some of the usual bananas bread.  Taste has plenty of crisp wheat, a moderate bananas presence, lemon zest, mild tartness, herbal spiciness, a mild sugary sweetness.  Full body, texture is a bit fluffy, carbonation is very lively.  Overall very easy to drink.  I read here I was supposed to note coniferous hop bitterness from the chinook, didnt note any of this.  The Shawinigan handshake is the name of secret handshake that is only known the by the locals of Shawinigan, so if you dont know this secret handshake, just be grateful you dont live in Shawinigan.

On tap at Chambly Fest
Appearance : Hazy yellow with a small head.

Aroma : Light wheat with some spices, light banana bread.

Taste : Lots of yeast with banana notes. Finish is quite yeasty. Nice wheat too with hops. Not very bitter.

Overall : Good stuff. Different take on the style. Well made. My notes were not very thorough on this one...

A orange amber ale with a thick onctuous lacing off white head. In aroma, a nice crisp grassy floral hops, nice and herbal, light coriander. In mouth, a smooth saison-like ale with light fruity esters, light but nice. On tap at Bieres et Saveur, Sept.3 2011.

on tap at brewpub. hazy dark golden, very nice white head, excellent retention/lacing. nose of wheat, citrus, light dusty, cereals, herbal hopping. taste is wheat with loads of citrus. lively, almost aggressive, medium body. medium long citrusy finish.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 My Bottom Line :  
Crushed wheat, a floral bouquet, ginger-like spiciness and coniferous hop greenness coalesce in this HopfenWeisse, as a moderate Weizen yeast personality (some bananas and some cloves) rides a subtle sweetness. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A veil of foam covers the cloudy blond. 
-The flavor profile are sharper when you leave out the yeast pour. Its as flavorful, but a bit muddled with the full yeast pour.
-This is a lot of fun to drink; the intensity level is not too high yet it is far from boring.
-Drinkability is very high due to the dryness and prickly carbonation.

Bottles and on tap at the Chambly festival.

Drank at Bières & Saveurs de Chambly 2011, on September 4. Honey golden hazy, small head. Malted wheat aroma with notes of dry and sweet herbs. Taste spice barley, notes of medical herbs, dry herbs bitterness. A dry and pleasant Weisen!

Loved this beer. Sample at Seaport Beer festival. Big banana notes backed by a lively carbonation and very refreshing finish. The 7% will sure sneak up on you as I didnt feel the alcohol presence in the tasting. Bravo!

On tap. Pours a cloudy burnt orange colour with tan head. Smoke, banana, citrus and spice on the nose. Wheaty on the palate with banana, candied sugar, spice and a real citrusy note. Light and refreshing for something so flavourful.
At Vices et Versa. Cloudy yellow (?) w tinge orange, surprisingly light color. Aroma and taste are TART with a simple dryness. Unexciting but OK.

Draft.  Small off-white head with murky amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, bubblegum, banana, some caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some earthy, clove, banana, faint alcohol.  Medium body, lightly sticky.

Draught at Churchkey.  Cloudy orange yellow, thick white had with great lacing.  Aroma of baked bread.  Taste has plenty of malt but a good dose of hops, so caramel flavors with a biter finish.  Good stuff.

On tap at the brewpub. Hazy peach colored pour, frothy white head. Aroma is a  very good mix of the american piney hops, some citrus aromas, tropical fruits that blend with the banana, yeasty german side. The wheatiness and hops of the aroma remind me somewhat of an american saison. Taste is quite fruity, slightly sweet, a mild hop bite and a some alcohol in the finish. Palate is highly carbonated but smooth. This beer is said to be of the same style as Brooklyner Hopfen-Weiss. I like this one more.
